alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Kimball County through 300 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Dix, or 15 miles southeast of Kimball, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix and Kimball Airport. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 15 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
